Korean People's Efforts for Independent National Reunification Supported by Guinean Figure 
    Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Banou Keita, director general of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea, in a statement on Jan. 9 expressed his belief that the hurricane of the independent reunification of Korea would sweep everywhere Koreans live this year.
 I am sure that all the Koreans in the north and the south and abroad will demonstrate once again the might of the nation this year by placing its interests above anything else under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration and waging a vigorous struggle as required by the idea of "By our nation itself," he added.
 He expressed full support for the joint New Year editorial carried by the newspapers of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Korean People's Army and the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League of the DPRK in which they called for waging a vigorous patriotic movement for independent reunification, peace against war and overall national unity.    
 He went on to say:    
During my several visits to Korea I saw the Korean people single-mindedly united around leader Kim Jong Il all out in the drive to build a reunified great prosperous powerful nation with high pride and noticed their strong will to reunify the country at an early date, in particular. 
 He reiterated his invariable friendly support for the efforts of the Korean people to achieve the country's independent reunification.

articles.content:
Book "Relationship between Paekje and Woe (Japan)" off Press 
    Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The Publishing House of Social Sciences of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea recently published the book "Relationship between Paekje and Woe (Japan)".
 The book authored by Prof. and Dr. Jo Hui Sung has a prologue, an epilogue and five chapters -- "Occasion and period that people of Paekje make inroads into Japanese islands", "Formation of small kingdom, Paekje", "Pro-Kaya and pro-Paekje forces of Kawachiwa Yamato", "Integration of western Japan by pro-Paekje Yamato government reflected in 'Nihongshoki (History of Japan)'" and "Relationship between Paekje and Woe (Yamato) in 7th century".
 The book writes that a group of Koguryo people went south and established a small feudal state in the third century B.C., which developed into Paekje. The book deals with the relationship between Paekje and Woe (Japan)--the big role and position of Paekje people in the establishment of a unified state in Japan and their influence on the historical development of Japan.

Kim Yong Nam Meets British Ambassador
    Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and conversed with outgoing British Ambassador to the DPRK David Arthur Slinn at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 On hand were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung and a staff member of the British embassy.
